item.description: rOpenSci ozunconf 2017 nominations html{ margin: 0; height: 100%; overflow: hidden; } iframe{ position: absolute; left:0; right:0; bottom:0; top:0; border:0; }

rOpenSci code of conduct The organisers of the Melbourne rOpenSci Unconference are committed to providing a welcoming and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, religion (or lack thereof), or technology choices. We do not tolerate harassment of conference participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate for any conference venue, including talks, workshops, parties, Twitter and other online media.

R OpenSci ozunconference 2017 Projects 🇦🇺 🏈 AFLW - AFL Data 🇦🇺 👩 🏈 AFLW - AFL Womens Data 🏏 cricinfo - access cricket data from cricinfo 🏠 datagovau - R package to download data catalogued at data.gov.au 🚀 icon - easily insert web icons 🇦🇺 🎨 ochRe - Australia-themed Colour Palettes 🛩 ozflights - pull Aviation data from BITRE 🛣 ozroaddeaths - Pull data from the Australian Road Deaths Database 〰️ realtime - Plot real time events 🔥 ronfhir - makes data available in R from servers that follow the FHIR format 🕙️ stow - simple version control in R 〽️ styles - themes for base plots 🚋 tRainspotting - gtfs-r feeds from R, with leaflet maps If there are any projects that you know are missing please fork this document on GitHub, make changes, and then send a pull request.

rOpenSci unconf terms and conditions These terms and conditions apply to the rOpenSci Unconference 2017 (“Event”) hosted by and on behalf of The rOpenSci project, a fiscally sponsored project of Numfocus Inc, a non-profit registered in Texas (P.O. Box 90596 Austin, TX 78709 USA). The purpose of the Event is to encourage development of open source tools and grow a community of open source developers and mentors around the R programming language.
